intro: Thulinella, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, particularly in the arid and semi-arid zones. The plants typically have small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. Thulinella species are often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
